net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis.bovw

Class VLADBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis.bovw.VLADBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleFeatureVLADBuilder

    public class VLADBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    General class creating bag of visual words vocabularies parallel based on k-means. Works with SIFT, SURF and MSER. Date: 24.09.2008 Time: 09:38:53
    Author:
    Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at

      • VLADBuilder

        public VLADBuilder(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader reader,
           int numDocsForVocabulary)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new instance of the BOVWBuilder using the given reader. The numDocsForVocabulary indicates how many documents of the index are used to build the vocabulary (clusters).
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader used to open the Lucene index,
        numDocsForVocabulary - gives the number of documents for building the vocabulary (clusters).

      • VLADBuilder

        public VLADBuilder(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader reader,
           int numDocsForVocabulary,
           int numClusters)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new instance of the BOVWBuilder using the given reader. The numDocsForVocabulary indicates how many documents of the index are used to build the vocabulary (clusters). The numClusters gives the number of clusters k-means should find. Note that this number should be lower than the number of features, otherwise an exception will be thrown while indexing.
        Parameters:
        reader - the index reader
        numDocsForVocabulary - the number of documents that should be sampled for building the visual vocabulary
        numClusters - the size of the visual vocabulary

The numClusters gives the number of clusters k-means should find. Note that this number should be lower than the number of features, otherwise an exception will be thrown while indexing. TODO: write

        lireFeature - lireFeature used

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()

      • index

        public void index()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Uses an existing index, where each and every document should have a set of local features. A number of random images (numDocsForVocabulary) is selected and clustered to get a vocabulary of visual words (the cluster means). For all images a histogram on the visual words is created and added to the documents. Pre-existing histograms are deleted, so this method can be used for re-indexing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • indexMissing

        public void indexMissing()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Indexes all documents in the index, that do not include the VLAD feature yet.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                                                   throws java.io.IOException

        public boolean getUseParallelClustering()
        Indicates whether parallel k-means is applied (true) or just the single threaded implementation (false)
        Returns:
        true is parallel k-means

        Indicates whether parallel k-means is applied (true) or just the single threaded implementation (false)
        Parameters:
        useParallelClustering - set to true if parallel processing should be used.
